synopsis: In the year 2417 new space time agent Valerian embarks on his first voyage. In the year 912 he meets the irrepressible Laureline. Despite the best of intentions, they find that they have somehow changed the future and there is much to set aright.

After arriving at Central Point, Valerian and Laureline encounter Prince Baral who’s on the run from Gork, an evil tyrant with plans to conquer the sapce. The partners help the prince escape to his embassy, making a adversary of Gork in the process.

The poverty-stricken partners are hired by members of the Shingouz race to track down a “holy vase” on the planet. It turns out to be a simple task for Valerian and Laureline, but afterward, they're plagued by nightmares that are connected to the relic.

Valerian and Laureline join an emigrant group en route to Peter, a planet known as the “Promised Land”. Without knowing, however, one of their newfound friends is a spy for Vlago, which seeks to take over Peter, while another has a bomb in her forehead.

Valerian and Laureline finds a treasure for Zabole, but their client betrays Laureline by leaving her in space, while Valerian is trapped in the palace to be married to her daughter. Worse, all men involved with the women of the family turn to stone!

While in a junkyard looking for spaceship parts, Valerian finds an android, but they're both taken by Dr. Zessel. Zessel creates an android double of Valerian to pump Laureline for information, while Val and a new buddy hatch a plot to escape the dungeon.
Valerian and Laureline explore a mysterious derelict spaceship that went missing 153 years ago. Except they discover that it might not quite be devoid of life...

Valerian rescues Prince Coren from pirates, but his ship is damaged, forcing them to land on a planet. While looking for help, Valerian hits his head. When he comes to, standing over him is a female version of Coren, and this one has a major crush on Val.

Valerian and Laureline are to fly a creature to a zoo, but it runs away and a bird that bites Valerian. The bird's poison causes insanity, then death, so it's up to Laureline to get an antidote requires a flower from the Tree with 100,000 Limbs.

Valerian and Laureline are hired to transport Drazel eggs. Easy enough, except that whoever hears a Drazel cry is doomed to laugh to death and they are to hatch in 24 hours. Flying a shortcut through the route leads to a collision and the loss of time.

Dr. Zessel is back with a heinous scheme than an android ripoff: He switches the minds of Valerian and Laureline, a disaster when they're on dates with ambassadors. And Gork tries to take over the Coalition by switching his mind with its chairperson.
Valerian and Laureline find themselves on the supposedly vanished Earth, during the Western pioneer era!

Valerian and Laureline's dream vacation turns into a nightmare. It's not bad enough that their promised luxury resort is a dump. The planet they're staying on is also swept by tornadoes and soon enough will collide with its sister planet!

Valerian and Laureline are hired to locate a data cube containing the recipe so appealing that whoever cooks it for the god known as Merisarion shall be granted a wish. They find the cube, but will they have time to cook with the Quartet of Death?

Valerian and Laureline's relationship has hit the skids due to his recklessness, but before he can try to get back in her good graces, Laureline becomes a rising commercial star...albeit one whose strings are pulled by the sinister Vlagos.

title.jp: There's No Time Like the Present

synopsis: Somehow, Valerian slips into a parallel world where Earth is intact, Laureline doesn't know him, and her father is in league with Vlagos. Even in a parallel world, how could history run that course...and how can Valerian get back to his world?!

Valerian and Laureline return to the solar system where Earth was. They hear weak signals coming from the moon! After touching down, they discover a Moonbase and inside, footage featuring a gentleman who offers a clue as to what happened to the Earth.

After Valerian foils an assassination of the emperor, he and Laureline track down the murderer to an ice planet. But they're after no run-of-the-mill assassin. Burgas is Galactic Interpol's most wanted criminal, one who has been around for 700 years!

Valerian and Laureline rescue the prince of Aspara. It turns out that he's in the middle of a great space race to determine the new ruler and when our heroes hear that the villainous Gork is also a contestant, they're determined to help Cyrfranu win!

Valerian and Laureline are hoodwinked and kidnapped at a casino, then forcibly sent to Ukbar, a gray desert planet. The only way they'll be able to get home again is by recovering the mysterious stone artifact, Ozel Ran, which contains tremendous energy.

When Valerian and Laureline board the Legenda after a long time away, little do they know that the enigmatic gray-haired man did some “fine-tuning” to the ship. When they take her for a spin, they time jump to 1862, and happen to meet a young Jules Verne!

Valerian and Laureline return to the planet to stop a contamination of creatures...the poison-spewing Schniarfeurs that cause victims to turn violent. Valerian will have to stop this latest Vlagos alone, as his partner, Laureline, has become infected!

Our two heroes are invited to the wedding of Prince, but a surprise guest shows up...Alcia, Baral's former sweetheart and member of the anti-Vlagos resistance! Which is awkward, and not least because two other guests are Gork and the Imperator of Vlagos!

En route to a conference at Central Point, Prince is sidetracked by a rescue. Later, when he arrives, he stuns the group of reporters before him by praising Vlagos' monopoly on dirty energy. Valerian suspects something is up, perhaps a plot by Vlagos?

The most popular show in the galaxy pits people against deadly creatures and there's a reward for whoever tracks down the source of the transmission. Valerian and Laureline become contestants, but how long can they last against the ferocious beasts?!

Valerian and Laureline go undercover in the wild world of 25th century filmmaking to investigate the movie studio of action movie producer Waldoun Boxoff, suspected of passing on top secret info to Vlagos.

Criminals Bart and Garp are caught by Valerian and Laureline, but on the way to jail, they are hit by a storm. Then the party jumps to the year 912, only moments before Valerian and Laureline first met! Worse, Bart and Garp escape and begin roaming!

While repairing the ship, Laureline travels to Betel for the friends' wedding. Unfortunately, Pirna disrupts it by kidnapping Laureline and taking her along on a quest for a regenerative substance that Pirna will use to create an indestructible armada!

As Pirna relentlessly pursues Valerian and Laureline, the Legenda takes a hit and they're forced to make an emergency landing on an unknown planet. Pirna and her minions follow, but then the sleeping planet awakes...and it's hungry.

Valerian and Laureline manage to outmaneuver pirates, but at the cost of landing on another planet. Tempers flare when they end up on a desert island, as Valerian can't get used to the lack of technology while Laureline from the Middle Ages feels at home.

Valerian and Laureline play detectives on the planet Shingouz, where resources are so scarce, that even drinking water and breathing is taxed. Our heroes set out to discover who is stealing artwork from the galaxy's most famous museum.

Valerian buys a star map that supposedly leads to Maya, a lost planet and home to the infinitely wise Gingiks. Valerian goes there with the skeptical Laureline, unaware that they're being tailed by Gork, who wants infinite wisdom for his own purposes.

Valerian is back in Paris, reliving episodes from his youth...but something's wrong. He's confused and has no memories of Laureline. Will he ever be able to return to her or is Valerian forever doomed to be lost in nostalgia?

Valerian and Laureline embark on a perilous mission to Vlagos in disguise in order to meet up with that world's leader of the resistance and destroy a new weapon of mass destruction that could wipe out the entire galaxy.

Alcia and her resistances intercept a message from Vlagos at the expense of revealing their location. Pirna's attack destroys the Moonbase, but Alcia and the others could pass the info on to Valerian and Laureline, who set out to foil Pirna's plans.

Prince reveals to the Council the information that Valerian and Laureline brought back from Planet X-34, indicting Vlagos, but then a report arrives that implicates Baral in the murder of a scientist! This is the beginning of the end for the Empire!

Prince Baral turns his back on the throne to marry Alcia, but the wedding is interrupted by the attacking Vlagosian armada. Valerian, Laureline and the rest face a losing battle, though one of their allies, Klinch, has an idea that can turn it around.

With the good guys all driven underground, there's only one thing left for Valerian and Laureline to do: jam through time, and they end up in 19th century Scotland, where they encounter Mr. Albert, who is about to reveal just what happened to the Earth!

After arriving at Central Point, Valerian and Laureline encounter Prince, who’s on the run from Gork, an evil tyrant with plans to conquer the galaxy. The partners help the prince escape by taking to the sewers, making a adversary of Gork in the process.

Vlagos now rules the part of the galaxy while in the backwater of Earth, Raymond de Tancarville is about to marry Laureline. Can Valerian pull off a universal two-fer, saving both the partner that he loves and the galaxy that they've left behind?!
